New Records: Fazalhaq Farooqi completed his maiden five-wicket haul for Afghanistan in international cricket.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran registered a 154-run partnership, the second-highest opening stand in the men's T20 World Cup.
Afghanistan's score of 75-0 is their highest powerplay score in the T20 World Cup, bettering 64/2 vs South Africa at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai in 2016.
Key Match Events: Fazalhaq Farooqi's fiery spell in the first over dismissed Ronak Patel and Roger Mukasa on consecutive deliveries.
Mujeeb Ur Rahman deceived Simon Ssesazi with a googly in the next over.
Naveen-ul-Haq scalped two wickets in the fifth over, reducing Uganda to 18/5.
Farooqi was on a hat-trick for the second time in the 13th over after picking up two consecutive wickets.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz scored 76 off 45 balls, and Ibrahim Zadran scored 70 runs in 46 balls, propelling Afghanistan to 183/5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Uganda's batters struggled to pull off boundaries while Farooqi continued to be economical and rattle wickets.
Uganda eventually bundled out on a score of 58 in the 16th over and succumbed to a 125-run defeat.
An eventful 25-run over from Bilal Shah, which included five no-balls and five wides, helped Afghanistan pace past 150.
